92ACAC97BB2B44ED9EA9CCC1C4277081.description: Reflect on experiences that will inform engagement and set the foundation for life-long learning in the arts.

B28723E1F67F45F4AB1C4E067F6B4D67.description: Document and present learning and outline plans for continuing connections as a practicing artist.

4684944EF2A048199C34AB3DC4B901F6.description: Make community connections by meeting with local artists and/or business people to explore mentorship possibilities.

037E743986234C588E63E5514478C35A.description: Co-construct health and safety procedures for using shared studio spaces.

041BF4B782E1489883AF948818CFAB94.description: Research the mandate of a gallery and investigate the roles of gallery personnel (e.g., curators, educators, conservators, director, communications office).

A4A770746B0F4707907F871D934764D6.description: Research artist associations and supporters of the arts (e.g., Sask Arts, SaskCulture, Canadian Artists’ Representation/Le front des artistes canadiens, Organization of Saskatchewan Arts Council, Canada Council), artists’ guilds, artist-run centres and arts education organizations (e.g., Canadian Society for Education through Art, National Art Education Association).

B66F3B72CB0F43D080E9918DEA61AAE0.description: Deepen understanding of gallery culture and community by visiting galleries and arts organizations and presenting career information to peers.

764B62062606473D96F07237606D1789.description: Research and discuss the business of art including supports offered by arts organizations.

31579F90AFCD4EBAB8870A98295DFB3A.description: Make interdisciplinary links between art, science, technology, design and mathematics.

106324AE6289417886165ABB343C33EF.description: Explore the interconnected relationship between the artist, the art and the viewer.

36F7DFFC4DF64847A0C852ABA40E1A27.description: Describe how visual culture and personal history contribute to own practice and knowledge formation.

14D5A7089953408DB072837A748C3199.description: Research an artist whose work is personally meaningful and reflects aesthetic, cultural, historical or spiritual knowledge.

5272AB8E717C49459CAC74A18B152165.description: Describe the significance of specific art works in shaping content or challenging assumptions in history, society or culture.

C4FB615A64D848FBBC39DA3E40376B81.description: Differentiate between knowledge that is spiritual or sacred and knowledge that is secular and how these are represented in art (e.g., architecture, painting, craft).

E655660DEDD842BDAD4996DCDBA9AFE2.description: Examine and interpret the work of First Nations and Métis artists to learn how knowledge is shared and culture is sustained across generations.

2F3166A2724C4F02ABF5F3A101D665D6.description: Assess how knowledge is produced and shared in various ways through a range of art forms including those produced by First Nations and Métis artists.

368747FFFC49434EBECC45E9ED43F5A8.description: Cultural/Historical (CH) Goal: Students will investigate the content and aesthetics of the arts within cultural, historical and contemporary contexts and understand the connection between the arts and the human experience.

1D05C023C4E1404CA4C1614BAB9BEB26.description: Conduct a critical inquiry into own practice by reviewing creative process and portfolio development and share learning with peers.

A8F3FED5BA054CD6853FB14AE18D342E.description: Articulate and assess own role in the creative process leading to the work under review.

B639C887C37446FF87DEE9ABABCC6F73.description: Suggest solutions to artistic problems and set goals during regular progress checks.

9DDD0F1EBE2748A887DB4575D84C482B.description: Determine which aspects of the work are most important to alter or revise and what makes an artwork most successful.

385E69388A4A40FFA4EF0AD5BCA6B5C9.description: Use descriptive and constructive feedback making suggestions for improvements or extensions.

F3E63AD6DB3F4CA48C36B4C6C653CDF5.description: Demonstrate an understanding of the complexity of communicating through art.

5093978C45F74757936C6A4D813C218F.description: Describe own decision making and problem-solving processes and reflect on the effectiveness of choices made.

7A33BE534DAF43BA956807F5F731BB57.description: Evaluate artwork against co-constructed criteria using art terminology.

1D414D7DEDD34CA68997C50A3AF06B6E.description: Set norms for respectful understanding of diverse cultures and personal histories prior to beginning analytical discussion of student works.

C114576A2DB64D1AAE2A73F1FB33F5CE.description: Evaluate, for the purpose of improvement, own works in progress and completed works during regular critiques with peers.

D897D8E6DC1149F7B897550A613309FF.description: Inquire how different people respond to the same work in different ways and how that reflects life experiences, cultural context and world view.

DCAAA0987D21484E88A8F33C7CFB4EDF.description: Analyze connections between self and selected art works

4FEB83407389413EB069DAF8059F5AC0.description: Describe the visual language and conventions of the time period in which work was created.

266B4FA7B25241FFA17E00C26E312CE4.description: Identify how design principles, image development strategies and elements and principles of design affect the overall impact of works selected for study.

579EE502A4374A3996CB27ADE8BD7145.description: Use the language of art and appropriate terminology when writing or discussing artworks.

99593E22643043B28B960518B10DFECB.description: Use a critical process to convey an informed opinion within a formal critique/research paper including properly cited sources.

F0B96DEC2F0742728EBE1B81C5199CE4.description: Compare and contrast selected artworks through analysis of formal concerns, societal perspectives and artist intentions.

E9DE3838C22F4EE585C5795F75C8FA7E.description: Describe initial reactions and responses and determine what the artist did to initiate that reaction in the viewer.

9EC98532BF9140BAAB847AFCF53A16C2.description: View and evaluate professional art, including Indigenous art, by interacting with guest artists and by visiting galleries.

AEF72BE0B3FB4683876DBE36BA63E70F.description: Examine and critically respond, orally and in writing, to the work of professional artists utilizing a range of art criticism models.

CF923411667847119474E7369425F69E.description: Critical/Responsive (CR) Goal: Students will respond to artistic expressions of Saskatchewan, Canadian and International artists using critical thinking, research, creativity and collaborative inquiry.

DB1F191B613044F89D04BD56886A7928.description: Predict the future of visual art exhibitions considering factors such as diversity, inclusion and technological developments.

E9CC490C4D4D4C9BAAC6336258FF99DD.description: Document process and reflect on the impact of sharing work on self and the community.

EFE749A2806647D7AB06CC936DAB5607.description: Articulate intentions of works and choices for overall show through exhibition text and curatorial rationale.

3B9F9BFAAC0D494E99D71320BC80BA1C.description: Consider inclusive curatorial practices including purpose of show, selection process, exhibition space, matting work, producing advertising and show cards, when viewing a collection of art in a gallery or other exhibition space.

5218A0BCA676459CB428A6601A1AAEB7.description: Design exhibitions utilizing multimedia, lighting, sound, video and/or digital spaces.

A7E80385296745288CD80B71D0E889E8.description: Select works to exhibit that highlight own strengths.

102CB7DFE8AD403DB7D79CFA93CCBBBC.description: Co-construct and rank criteria for exhibition, including health and safety considerations, and apply to overall design within selected space.

841E29F21034462390861A1B87661AA4.description: Research exhibition opportunities for students initiated by local, global or online communities (e.g., performance piece, community project/show, website, social media, art competitions, etc.).

4279FDE27E2641C69270A7FC944861CE.description: Research the range of ways artists can promote and present their work for different audiences and different purposes.

284E69E809FF42F782C8F8930374A969.description: Prepare and present own work in a professional manner to share ideas with wider audience.

26B47B7B359849EE8CBAB39B2B6968B2.description: Build a collection of work demonstrating increasing technical skill and consistent trial and error in manipulating the elements of art, principles of design and image development strategies.

E8D28EF782864B4CB38E8175B7017EEA.description: Play with visual organization beyond implied boundaries of compositional rules (e.g., rule of thirds, rule of odds, rule of space, orientation, vantage point, geometry, focal point, rest areas) through directed studio practices.

06616A75ABE74BC69E1D905563ACB3D4.description: Use one or more of these preliminary works as starting points for a more extensive piece.

8D355B577BAE4CEAB350E43314466392.description: Engage in a series of quick skill-building challenges to explore the effects of focusing on selected elements of art, principles of design and/or image development strategies.

56C37A4AEFB445968CE74E424828D4CC.description: Research varied methods of visual organization and stylistic approaches and their cultural influences including those used by Indigenous artists.

028260F5EFDA42009C25740E6C4FF9AD.description: Produce works that purposefully and creatively manipulate compositional and design strategies to express a point of view or communicate an idea.

9DEB89900DD741EB94A0D934D96EF4EB.description: Evaluate effectiveness of creative process in developing works that demonstrate active risktaking and thoughtful revision.

19FFD3BF21C44E86B3D1B1F32F3C9D37.description: Track own progress (e.g., new ideas, skills) and regularly record the development of work up to completion through well-composed photographs, including for example: selecting and photographing completed works for submission to external agency or postsecondary institution meeting their criteria for submission and optimizing images for print, digital sharing, and/or display.

249C0B2F27EC451D964A6579FED56529.description: Research and co-create criteria for the selection, storage and display of portfolio items (e.g., documentation in digital and other formats of one’s creative process and products, depth and breadth of ideas, media and techniques represented).

ABCC75F2568242BB8A610FBA52B24690.description: Compose own library of inspirational references, notations, artifacts, own photographs, media exploration, visual notes and other source materials inspired by surroundings, other artists and other disciplines.

D5458BDC5CE64A1F97D4DAD8A75A661C.description: Explore and experiment with additional methods to foster a broader creative process, including for example: flexibility with new media and technologies, fluency in observational work including life drawing, on-site art making during experiential field trips and responses to visual culture and personal environment.

9894202B3DB345C68C6E98D46194DF6F.description: Maintain a sketchbook or art journal containing initial sketches and drafts, research and reference work demonstrating persistence in skill development.

D77DD7FBB2F84564B518A59D5884309F.description: Describe and record own distinctive way of approaching a creative task to develop understanding of strengths and weaknesses of that approach.

117FCD7FC50247E0B4525B2B594BB607.description: Compile and photograph own creative products including methods for initiating new work through practice and research.

85216CAA5C9C4868B3C6153EFE595EEE.description: Describe stages of own creative process and compare them to those used by practicing artists from a variety of fields.

2FF82F96E1E34FCCAECAF044212CB4CE.description: Regularly document and develop own creative process (e.g., inspiration, research, sketches, production, media skills, evaluation, refinement) up to and including completed works.

6CA29F20B8D2415EABF04A396E47ABBB.description: Explain how portfolio pieces show own ideas and evidence of significant development in work inspired by the creative property of other artists maintaining reference citations or visual bibliography.

B7CAF5AD302A41E4A2903C387727373B.description: Evaluate own portfolio for possible copyright infringement or the unethical use of the work of others, including using another medium to copy work, and refine or alter works as needed

0C89AEE7DE5D46958B682775FBAAABDA.description: Play with styles and approaches, while building skills and investigating own ideas.

A9863576B02747468542D8B8671ADA81.description: Consult Indigenous Knowledge Keepers and artists to understand and develop respect for sacred imagery and practices of gifting learning.

452E50DD33674A9E811314E1E214635A.description: Research plagiarism policies of universities, colleges, art schools and art programs.

9C87C6B3AA88447181BEFAD0D6E8FBB0.description: Discuss legal and ethical issues associated with art making and marketing (e.g., authorship, copyright, ownership, censorship, appropriation, use of responsible practices, respecting cultural/religious symbols or iconography).

3226E7D136964369B7CC531517CD9900.description: Evaluate and apply methods to establish authenticity and avoid imitation such as making use of own photographs as source material, rendering imagery directly from life and using symbols or visual words to convey personal meaning.

476714DA95814A9CB0696DDF934E558A.description: Examine emerging trends, alternative media and current technologies in art and reflect on how information from the past and present may be integrated in own exploration of recurring themes.

C9D94D6030BE4317B07E6B54F65662E7.description: Discuss artworks, along with possible controversy, that make use of appropriated imagery in the service of the artist’s intent.

E20A161C200B4BC0B52AB0692B0212A5.description: Investigate a wide range of artworks, including those from other disciplines, for the maker’s influences and present findings about artistic integrity for class discussion.

0E28C1F6AC1644D78814DF114DC4492D.description: Invent and adapt style variations in new works influenced by selected artists.

7CD5290418FC49A2993CB598A313C770.description: Critique work for a focused, emotive message, skillful use of select media and varied visual arrangements relating to a strong underlying visual idea.

A93354CA75C2422D8807DF254D307FAC.description: Reflect regularly on own portfolio and continue personal practice to develop artistic competencies, including pushing the boundaries of selected media.

BAECF8D29F294E3EBB580DE33B9DFE43.description: Extend the investigation through independent study that explores related and/or unexpected questions inspired by other disciplines.

8B04B8D7D80E44CFBC3583A4E5B32741.description: Pursue varied responses to the inquiry, including storytelling through art, to demonstrate artistic competencies with concept, composition, execution and analysis.

2A927211E2BD48459B27E8D48D7F3AEA.description: Establish and apply safe studio practices that respect the health and well-being of everyone sharing the space.

8949D8299DD3488EA9637BF52EB8F8BE.description: Initiate research by using art strategies, such as thumbnail sketches, annotated or illustrated text and maquettes, to explore, reveal and develop the inquiry.

45A851A705F5412F901FAD671034DAA2.description: Set inquiry goals and parameters with teacher guidance that foster strengths and allow the investigation to shift or extend.

48AA16FF557D4882AA5427BD629BBE25.description: Conduct an in-depth inquiry investigating a consistent theme or idea within a body of work demonstrating insight into ways that artists create in order to learn.

AA135AA2442E4A69A77A5E6857221D2F.description: Creative/Productive (CP) Goal: Students will inquire, create and communicate through dance, drama, music and visual art.
